title: Hobby horse
marks:
Inscription

on back of seat, burned into wood:
text: This is not the average child's rocking horse. Its minimalist design allowed American children to rethink the horse-and-rider scenario and instead become a fighter pilot locked in a dogfight with the Luftwaffe or an astronaut flying to the moon in a space shuttle. Creative Playthings holds true to the same ideals they had in the 1950s and 1960s: creating educational, simple, and abstracted modern toys for children, primarily out of wood.
description: curved bottom and top sections; bumpers at ends of rocking part and back of seat; stick with red ball at top at front; light varnish overall
creditline: Gift of funds from The Gynecologic Society of America
